sentence: it was working perfectly fine until i woke up one morning and the screen was black.
two weeks later i found out that the computer wasn't able to be fixed.
i had to either tilt the laptop so i could hear anything, or resort back to headphones.
i had so much problem with this laptop.
specially connecting with wifi, please do your research on the wifi issue with samsung laptop before buying this machine.
i wish i could throw this laptop in trash, but i have spend close to 800 bucks on it.
just recently tried to boot up my dell again and i still get the 7 beeps of death.
from everything i've read it's a motherboard problem that's not worth fixing.
bought it to replace my dell xps which works fine but weighs a ton!
this laptop was great ...at first.....white spot on screen after 4 months of use.
also imprint of keys is permenantly on screen.

after having this laptop 4 months i was ready to replace it (i replace my laptop once a year) now having the screen/keyboard issues only progress i will be having to purchase a new laptop earlier than anticipated.
i will not be buying another samsung.
i bought this laptop to use for work, not as a backup computer.
some have seen problems with wi-fi but this one has not had any wi-fi problems at all.

this was supposed to come with 4gb of ram, yet mine only came with 2gb so i had to upgrade it to 4gb myself to reduce the stuttering of doing simple things such as using skype and google chrome at the same time.
another things is the charger that came with the one i purchased was in bad shape as is and lasted less than a month.
the laptop was loaded with a bunch of junk i had to remove which i expected from reading the review from pc magazine.
has never been restarted me, the only thing is that the external texture is very dirty with dust.
the good: lots of hard drive space lots of memory the bad: everything else.
the touchpad on this, even with the sensitivity turned way up, is like having to rub your finger against sandpaper before the cursor moves.
i have to restart this machine every day, about 3x a day just to reset the sound.
update flash, update sound driver, nothing works.
the full brightness of the screen is what the dimmest setting would have been on a mac.
computer works great but windows 8 is a joke.
should have done more research on this, i didn't realize how much windows changed, makes a laptop with no touch screen pretty useless.
i've even accidentally drained it down to 0% a couple times and it still holds a long charge.
i was getting tired of lugging around an old asus g55 8 lb gaming laptop and this new gigabyte u24f is fantastic, only 3 lbs and more powerful graphics card.
it is comparable to a macbook air pro etc.. that cost $2500.... i am not a mac fan.
no need to take it into a specialist.
when you plug it in initially, you see a blinking light for a few seconds to confirm, but otherwise, you have to check the battery icon on the screen.

worst laptop i have seen, i have purchased 50+ of these for my work as the replacement model for the elitebook 8570w, these machines are constantly needing repairs, have had a bad bios update that will cause the machine to get extremely hot.

i have had multiple motherboards replaced (3 in one machine before it ever got deployed to a user), monitors replaced, video card fans needing replacement, displayport issues, pc will hibernate when power settings are set not to (and will not resume without holding down power button to kill) do not waste your money, these are overpriced and not a quality machine, half of the machines i received, the keyboards are not even properly snapped in.
the touch screen stop working after a certain time and the lenovo support apparently can not fix it or don't want it, really disgusted, don't buy this product
in the last year and a half i've had every problem i could imagine with this laptop.
i've even sent it back to lenovo 3 times for them to replace my hard drive.
the problem is that it rarely works as it should.
i am big on being able to use two finger swipes to scroll through webpages and documents, and this laptop has that feature about 20% of the time.
in addition to that, the touchpad frequently freezes and i'm left waiting for minutes at a time for it to start functioning again. -
i've used this for easily 6 hours without needing a charge.
but now less than two years after buying it, the battery no longer charges (it's stuck at 34%) and will not run if not plugged in.
the second i disconnect the power cord, the computer shuts down and will not restart until plugged in again, despite the fact that battery indicator says it has 34% charge.
overall not a bad build but system had allot of driver issues with amd and wouldn't even run my games.
great machine but some sloppy build quality.
mousepad randomly is unable to scroll or will scroll all the way and all the way down with the lightest touch.
sometimes some of my programs just shut down out of nowhere.
restarts randomly.
do not buy - after approximately 8 months it started turning off at random.
checking the forums, it appears to be a problem with the design of the power button.
it will turn on, stay on for about 2 minutes and shut off.
not to mention there are a few other problems.
it's everything it says it is!
i could go on, on, and i just can't believe all it does for the price i paid for it.
i love this laptop, it has just enough power to play any game i throw at it, as well as allow me to do all my school work.
if you can get it at a good price, go for it.
my iphone, my ipad even my cable box is able to see my wireless but my lenovo laptop!
the 2 options to control the cursor are great (i love the red joystick in the keyboard center) and the touch-pad works flawlessly, you can only find this in a ibm (now lenovo) or in a toshiba.
i needed a very portable, full port (hdmi, vga, 4.0 usb, etc) with a decent, low consumption intel processor in a bullet-proof constructed body.
good quality , shipping too long.
if you want the best, this is it.
handles everything i throw at it and easy upgrades down the road.
of course it is heavy and not the best battery power... you are powering two of the best graphic cards!
3.5 hours of continuous use, but in consideration of the power and speed i can live with that.

but the left trackpad button occationally will click without actually working, and immediately i noticed that when i press it and have my finger resting near the bottom or side of the trackpad, my mouse will move that direction on the screen without me telling it to.
the reason why this gets two stars is never get a pc with two hard drives.
i upgraded my old dell xps15 to this thinking the two hard drives would be a luxury, they are not.

i have been working on this pc for hours just to get it up and working, which involved making two outlook accounts, 3 profiles, many google searches and editing the registry to get the default user profile location set to the d: (mechanical 1tb) hard drive instead of my ssd (which is where the operating system is).
that worked, however, there is no way to change the default program installation directory.
i am extremely dissapointed and i'm considering removing or upgrading the ssd just to eliminate the program installing hassle.
mine died after 5 months of use - warranty is only for 3 months
pretty nice laptop but mouse pad was broken.
it died , the lobtop is not working anymore after the second use untill now they didn't prepare/change it no clear policy!!!
no fast as i expected but ok and really light
i like the computer unfortunately there is not enough hard drive to even download latest updates from windows.
i am not a gamer, but after i saw the speed and graphics of this laptop; i may become one!
this laptop does everything i expected it to do.
i didn't know it came with a usb-c port but that happened to work well with my nexus 6p.
didn't come with much bloatware, just a couple asus apps that i had to disable on startups.
keyboard came pretty natural to me, didn't find any of those odd shaped important keys.
from system performance stand point, having have i5 processor, its not meeting my expectations, especially the boot up time.
it gives you quite the kick but beware of this company and their customer service.

when i did decide to use the keyboard, it went out on me while my warranty was still active but i sought help from an outside computer expert and it turned out to be a dust issue so he cleaned the dust out and it worked for the duration of when i needed the keyboard which was probably about twice a week for 4 weeks.
it looks like a museum piece.
spend a little more for a better laptop.
decent laptop for the price, but the picture quality is poor.
i'm just an amateur photographer, but even a lay person would notice the pixelation.
i bought this laptop on a budget for a small business, but i'm still returning it.
cons: no esata - but i guess the inclusion of usb 3.0 makes up for it.
weight - 6.4 lb (2.9 kg) is a bit too much, but you're getting a lot of muscle.
it seems that the fan issue was a known manufacturing issue, little help from hp, leaving the only option of dumping the computers, pulling hard drives and trashing the computers.
i should have listened to the review sand steered clear of hp computers they should stick to printers they seem to have that product under control.
scrolling is virtually a no-go, flipping back to the top whenever you let go.
just as i ordered.
hinged top broke after 4 years.,..
very cheap hinge...do not buy asus
i got this as a gift along with assassin's creed 3 and it runs graphics intensive programs like that with no problems at all.
this item arrived with many software problems.
i took it to best buy and they had to restore the computer.
i didn't try any other games but was able to play wow with high settings.
when not watching video the display is bright and easy to read however when video is played the display is grainy.
in today's laptop market this is a display i would expect in a laptop that sold for a lot less.
i like everything about this laptop but the poor display makes this machine a dud.
the computer worked very well for seven days, at which time it suddenly "blue-screened" three times in one hour.
it would only enter about 50% of key strokes.
this is the worst laptop i've ever had it never wants to load usually freezes during start up as soon as i enter my password.
the firsy dvd i put in got hung up on a piece of rubber inside the computer.
come on hp step your game up.
however, i'm a little old school when it comes to the mouse function.
the on board mouse (track pad) is nice with it multi-function, however when typing it becomes an issue as my palms depress the pad at times and the cursor jumps.
additionally track pad is not centered on keyboard, so my hands do not go to home keys automatically.
i'm always having to adjust my position to the home keys.
pressure from palms activate track pad, and cursor jumps. (
usb ports interfere with mouse operation.
microsoft really has changed the windows as we have known them.
the problem that i had was the end of the dvd door kept falling off.
amazon couldn't replace it.
the space is not the best, but if you get beyond that, its an awesome laptop.
it gets about three hours a battery life, and has great speakers compared to other netbooks.
xp is nice, but is little boring, so right now i am running linux.
this product met my expectations.
i've owned this laptop for less than a year and it was sent into the shop 4 times.
my friend owned the exact same model and also had problems with this laptop.
this seems to me that their laptops are faulty enough where they have a backup solution always.
their representatives are not up to date with their policies (a general trend considering how often i've called them).
my other one, however, has been a basket case since the first day i got it.
also, the speakers are not recognized a lot of the time.
before you purchase this or similar models you should do an internet search for hinge breaking through laptop screen.
i never did nothing more then simple online browsing, and one day it decided to not turn on again.
when we requested to just downgrade to windows 7, this machine did not have the drivers deemed necessary.
seriously, i was ready to break this with my bare hands numerous times throughout the year.
they're probably shipping it with faulty hardware.
i won't berate asus since they're a good company, and i've only heard good things about their products, but simply stay away from this specific model of laptop.
i had the one year acer warranty and called them to get help, but they argued that the issue was due to a windows 8 software problem and could not help me.
acer, if you're going to give warranties to your customers, don't say it's not your fault that a computer breaks after a month.
getting the old, plugged in but not charging message.
i have to put a lower rating on this laptop because with how little i use it and how well i take care of it, the battery should have lasted much longer.
this is really really disappointing to me and makes me want to shy away from msi in the future.
the touch pad don't work very good, how ever it's fixed by using a wireless mouse.
i like it, even though its a little bit slow.
computer battery only lasted 8 mo.
if you have two tabs open, the machine freezes.
this laptop is so cool, but overheats a lot.
overall, i am quite happy with this computer, aside from the space bar issue.
window8 is rediculous though :) i installed ubuntu 14.10 and it worked perfectly out of the box, but later switched to xubuntu b/c unity was annoying.
sound on the low side and hard drive space not much, i will be upgrading and my wife loves it
i have not mastered the leap motion but i am working on it.
i bought the transfer cord and it's working out.
their not cheap, but their worth every penny.
dell is hard to beat
very slim for a gaming laptop but it needs better temperature control designs.
dust accumulates very quick especially when using it as a desktop substitute.
very hard to clean the dust off as there's multiple in between segments, from metal to plastic to speakers.
works fine, processor slow
we tried to have it repaired at office depot and they could not even get it open to replace the hard drive.
i will say that gateway installs a large amount of garbage software onto the netbook though making it seem very slow right out of the box.
somehow gateway managed to lock down the bios and or hard drive to prevent the installation of other operating systems.
i have loaded several quad boot os netbooks in the recent past, and for whatever reason i can not get this pcs bios to even acknowledge external drives/media on boot up.
the hdd is a lil slow ata, but other than that it serves its purpose well.
lenovo got rid of a lot of keys, and rearranged others forcing me to use the hated 'track-pad'.
that key no longer exists, as well as the 'number key pad'.
you can remap them back to their original settings but it took me a lot of digging on the internet to find out how 4) the battery is one of the few good things.
i got it repaired just because i couldn't take it anymore but for all i know they just put a sticker on it saying they fixed it when they actually did nothing because nothing changed.
and conveniently the warranty ran out so i can't get it fixed a second time.
i bought this computer for $800ish and knowing what i know now would not pay even $50 for it.
opening the laptop requires both hands bc it is hard to open otherwise.
good but the fan sounds a lot!
more than a normal laptop i ever see.

it took forever for laptop to arrive and then there was something wrong with power cord... i was totally frustrated.. i wanted to send it back to get my money and contacted vender but never heard back from them...i guess this is just a lesson learned
i am reviewing this model so potential customers do not go through the same hassle as i did.
you will not be able to communicate with them as they will shift you from one technician to another.
i do recommend buying a portable mouse, as the mouse pad isn't that great, but it's no big deal.
very thin for a laptop with dvd drive (not so common anymore).

excellent machine...windows 8 does take some getting used to and the keypad is not lit but still good overall due to the fact that ur getting a machine with an i5 processor, 8 gigs of ram and a terabyte on the hard drive...an apple with those stats will b way more!!!
almost every day since i have tested it to its limits, playing games like tera, blade & soul, overwatch, ffxiv, and who knows what else on maximum settings. (

i've been able to multitask extremely well on it too, as i usually always have many windows open when i'm gaming (tabbing back and forth between the game, internet browser with multiple tabs open, music player, file explorer, and image editor), and i very rarely ran into issues.
this computer isn't a gaming computer, but a fantastic multimedia computer.
honestly, i expected it to be fried by now.
i write this review as a semi-farewell to a good friend.
it had a few scratches on the keyboard area had parts missing (the power cord was absent but i had a spare) hooked it up and let it charge for a full 24 hrs before i ever turned it on.
attempted to reinstall windows 7 with the factory install disk that came with it and got the blue screen of death.
over the years i have had various thinkpad's and after trying other brands, i couldn't wait to come back to the thinkpad series.
seems a little slow and sometimes the mouse doesn't work but the touchscreen does.
i wanted to like this laptop, it is cheap for an i5 system but it has some major flaws.
unlike other trackpads there is no way to adjust the sensitivity of the touch in the driver settings.
i uninstalled the wifi driver, got the very latest and reinstalled but the router changes were the only thing that seemed to help with wifi card.
there is no small access panel, and i found a teardown online, this thing has to be almost completely disassembled and the mother board removed to upgrade the ram.
the hard drive started to emit a high pitch noise almost as soon as the warranty expired.
this accompanied by the fact that the hard drive will resist shutting down when i put the computer into hibernate, sleep, or tell it to shut down.
the design prevents the hard drive from being removed without effectively exposing the entire system to dust, as it is all one piece that need be removed to work with any of the interior.
she can do school projects on it as well as leisure stuff like you tube and netflix.
when i called dell tech support they kept me on hold (about 75 minutes total), and transferred me three times.

so bottom line, the laptop itself is fine (the fan is slightly noisy but not bad), but the online diagnostic tools didn't load (minus one star) and the customer service by phone was time-consuming and not helpful (minus one star).
is a good machine, plus it has 2 year warranty and three additional months if you register on aorus website.

light the bad: the trackpad needs to be improved it's not good the battery charger is big and heavy, the machine is very light and portable, but they need to work on the charger design the screen bezzel looks ok but not so strong i know in some reviews some people is having problems with it but for now mine is ok, but looks fragile.
however, i think for almost $1500 the graphics card nvidia gtx 970m is not what it is to be expected.
after 21 months the video started having problems.
the bottom line is that for 21 months this laptop worked great but now it is a $1200.00 paperweight.
i will have to stick with dell.
got laptop that i ordered, it crashed, contacted dell for service, laptop is not in my name as per dell inc.
tech support advise laptop needed further technical analysis at their facility at owners expense.
the computer is everything we wanted it to be but still adjusting to the touch screen and new version of windows.
it came out of the box already with 100% disk usage.
it is all plastic.
it's very light and quickly, but hasn't keyboard light for writing in dark places.

wireless is not as good as my older xps and new single piece touchpad is no where near as good as my older unit (shut off wrist detection seems to help) outside of those issues, i am satisfied with this unit.
warranty included was next business day onsite.
i had to file a warranty request on the other unit i received due to touchpad issues (section of touchpad was non-responsive) this is my 5th dell laptop over the years and i continue to be happy.
good laptop overall, however the build quality can be improved.
i had to contact dell personally to get warranty info but guess what, i am unable to show transfer of ownership because this seller never contacted me back.
if your looking to buy buy something else.
after 5 months we started having problems and apple will not stand behind their products and neither will amazon!!!!!!
no other computer offers solid state for that price.
boots fast thanks to the ssd.
i don't think you can beat it for the money.
the graphics card (gtx 960) allows it to play any game.
no issue running fallout or battlefield.
the edges aren't smoothed out like dell computers, so if your wrists are resting on the edges, it will hurt.
stay away from this unit, it gets 2 thumbs down.
they are going to be our standard business laptop.
as far as the software, its not bad, but the blu ray its not working property and you have to download some patches and applications to make it work, so far no luck with all my bd disc.
hp replaced the keyboard, everything else work fine.
i always rest my left hand on the mouse pad unconsciously and end up highlighting something and type over them.
you will never find the home/end/pg up/pg down keys without looking at the keyboard.
works well but seems to hang unexpectedly when loading basic programs.
i get about 5 hours max running in battery saver mode.
the battery seems to discharge as well when not in use (when off...not in sleep mode.)
i love this laptop, would recommend but the only problem is that it does not support apple.
fast laptop, especially with an ssd hard drive.
even when having multiple programs open.
the laptop is good but lenovo should definitely work with having a longer battery life on this one.
i would recommend this laptop but be warned of the battery life and brightness.
but he wishes it were a touch screen.

if you want to use a mouse - fine it's a nice little laptop and just what i wanted - but the touchpad does not work and it won't work and if you get one and send it back - it appears the "fix" doesn't work.
i love it except the fact that my keyboard stopped working in less than 24 hours.. i tried everything but its still not working
even with an additional microsd card installed, the emmc fills up quickly and the the less free space the slower the machine runs.
the "but" to all this is i missed having a cd-rom drive, being able to play dvds, and the weirdest part is there isnt a "delete" button.
this is the 2nd unit i have purchased so that my desk has more work-space!
